revised_title: The Impact of World Wars on the Development of Atomic Energy and Large-Scale Scientific Organizations in the United Kingdom
tldr: The article discusses the effects of the two world wars on the development of science in the United Kingdom, focusing on atomic energy and the growth of large teams and organizations. It highlights the role of British scientists in the Manhattan Project and the development of nuclear fission, as well as the impact of these events on the scientific community and the future of physics.
